intro: Tetrastigma lineare, commonly known as the climbing raisin vine, is a member of the Vitaceae family. It is a perennial vine characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its berries are initially green and turn dark purple when mature, containing several seeds. Tetrastigma lineare is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing along fences, trees, and in shaded areas.
